info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 03 at 7:34PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT SOUTHWESTERN LITTLE RIVER... SOUTHEASTERN MCCURTAIN...CENTRAL CASS AND BOWIE COUNTIES THROUGH 815 PM CDT... At 733 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near De Kalb to 6 miles northwest of Maud to 13 miles northeast of Hughes Springs to 6 miles southwest of Linden. Movement was northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Atlanta, New Boston, Foreman, Hooks, Linden, De Kalb, Queen City, Redwater, Maud, Winthrop, Fairview, Leary, Avinger, Douglassville, Marietta, Almont, Spring Hill, Red Hill, Wallace, and Arden. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
